basic_operations

Class Arithmetic

  • java.lang.Object
    • basic_operations.Arithmetic

  • public class Arithmetic
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of static methods containing several elementary arithmetic functions.
    Author:
    pdokos

    • Method Summary

      static int centeredInverse(int a, int n)
      Finds the multiplicative inverse of a mod n; returns 0 if the inverse does not exist.

    • Method Detail

      • reduce

        public static int reduce(int m,
         int n)
        For n ≠ 0, returns the representative in {0, 1, ..., |n|-1} for the residue class of m mod n.
        Parameters:
        m - Any integer.
        n - Any non-zero integer.
        Returns:
        The representative in {0, 1, ..., |n|-1} for the residue class of m mod n
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if n is 0

      • reduce

        public static int reduce(long m,
         int n)
        For n ≠ 0, returns the representative in {0, 1, ..., |n|-1} for the residue class of m mod n.
        Parameters:
        m - Any long integer.
        n - Any non-zero integer.
        Returns:
        The representative in {0, 1, ..., |n|-1} for the residue class of m mod n
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if n is 0

           short n)
        For n ≠ 0, returns the representative in {0, 1, ..., |n|-1} for the residue class of m mod n.
        Parameters:

        n - a nonzero short integer
        Returns:
        The representative in {0, 1, ..., |n|-1} for the residue class of m mod n
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if n is 0

      • reducedSum

        public static int reducedSum(int a,
             int b,
             int n)
        Safely computes the reduced sum of two integers a and b mod n by casting a and b to long prior to computation.
        Parameters:
        a - any integer
        b - any integer
        n - any non-zero integer
        Returns:
        reduced sum of a and b mod n.

        Parameters:

        b - any short
        n - any non-zero short
        Returns:
        reduced sum of a and b mod n.

      • reducedProduct

        public static int reducedProduct(int a,
                 int b,
                 int n)
        Safely computes the reduced product of two integers a and b mod n by casting a and b to long prior to computation.
        Parameters:
        a - any integer
        b - any integer
        n - any non-zero integer
        Returns:
        reduced product of a and b mod n.

      • reducedProduct

        public static short reducedProduct(short a,
                   short b,
                   short n)
        Computes the reduced product of two shorts a and b mod n.
        Parameters:
        a - any short
        b - any short
        n - any non-zero short
        Returns:
        reduced product of a and b mod n.

      • findInverse

        public static int findInverse(int a,
              int n)
        Finds the multiplicative inverse of a mod n; returns 0 if the inverse does not exist. Note that a is invertible mod n if and only if gcd(a, n)=1.
        Parameters:
        a - Any integer.
        n - Any integer.
        Returns:
        The representative r, with 0<=r<n, of a^(-1) mod n, if it exists. Returns 0 if the inverse does not exist, or if n=0.

      • findInverse

        public static short findInverse(short a,
                short n)
        Finds the multiplicative inverse of a mod n; returns 0 if the inverse does not exist. Note that a is invertible mod n if and only if gcd(a, n)=1.
        Parameters:
        a - Any short integer.
        n - Any short integer.
        Returns:
        The representative r, with 0<=r<n, of a^(-1) mod n, if it exists. Returns 0 if the inverse does not exist, or if n=0.

      • centeredReduction

        public static int centeredReduction(int m,
                    int n)
        For n ≠ 0, returns the integer representative r, with -|n|/2 < r ≤ |n|/2, for the residue class of m mod n.
        Parameters:
        m - Any integer.
        n - Any non-zero integer.
        Returns:
        The integer representative r, with -|n|/2 < r ≤ |n|/2, for the residue class of m mod n
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if n is 0

      • centeredInverse

        public static int centeredInverse(int a,
                  int n)
        Finds the multiplicative inverse of a mod n; returns 0 if the inverse does not exist. Note that a is invertible mod n if and only if gcd(a, n)=1.
        Parameters:
        a - Any integer.
        n - Any integer.
        Returns:
        The integer representative r, with -|n|/2 < r ≤ |n|/2, of a^(-1) mod n, if it exists. Returns 0 if the inverse does not exist, or if n=0.

      • centeredProduct

        public static int centeredProduct(int a,
                  int b,
                  int n)
        Returns the representative r, with -|n|/2 < r ≤ |n|/2, for the reduced product of two int values a and b mod n.
        Parameters:
        a - any int value
        b - any int value
        n - any non-zero int value
        Returns:
        the representative r, with -|n|/2 < r ≤ |n|/2, for the reduced product of two int values a and b mod n.

      • getOrder

        public static int getOrder(int a,
           int n)
        Computes the multiplicative order of a mod n; returns 0 if gcd(a,n)>1. The order of a mod n is by definition the exponent k for which a^k is congruent to 1 mod n.
        Parameters:
        a - any integer.
        n - any non-zero integer.
        Returns:
        the multiplicative order of a mod n. Returns 0 if n=0, or a is not invertible mod n

      • getMultiplicativeGenerator

        public static int getMultiplicativeGenerator(int q)
        Finds the smallest positive integer whose reduction modulo the prime q is a generator for the multiplicative group of the field Z/qZ.
        Parameters:
        q - a prime number
        Returns:
        a generator for the unit group of the field Z/qZ. Returns 0 if q is not prime.

      • findIota

        public static int findIota(int q)
        Finds the representative r, with 0≤r<q/2, of the square root of -1 in Z/qZ, where q is a prime number, if it exists; otherwise returns 0. Note that the square root exists if and only if q is congruent to 1 mod 4.

      • findSquareRoot

        public static int findSquareRoot(int a,
                 int q)
        Finds the representative r, with 0≤r<q/2, of the square root of a in Z/qZ, where q is a prime number, if it exists; otherwise returns 0.
        Parameters:
        a - any integer
        q - a prime number
        Returns:
        square root of a mod q. Returns 0 if q is not prime, or a square root does not exist.

      • isSquare

        public static boolean isSquare(int a,
               int q)
        Determines whether a is a non-zero square mod the prime q via the Jacobi symbol.
        Parameters:
        a - any integer
        q - a prime number
        Returns:
        true if a is a non-zero square mod q. Returns false otherwise, or if q is not prime.

      • perfSqrt

        public static int perfSqrt(int n)
        Returns the square root of n if n≥0 is a perfect square, and -1 otherwise

      • isPrime

        public static boolean isPrime(int n)
        Basic primality test for n. Checks n for divisibility by numbers <= sqrt(n) which are congruent to ±1 mod 6.
        Parameters:
        n - Any integer.

      • gcd

        public static int gcd(int n,
      int m)
        Computes the gcd of m and n recursively via Euclidean algorithm.
        Parameters:
        n - Any integer.
        m - Any integer.
        Returns:
        The greatest common divisor of m and n. Returns 0 if m=n=0.

      • jacobiSymbol

        public static int jacobiSymbol(int m,
               int n)
        Computes Jacobi symbol recursively via reciprocity. The Jacobi symbol is defined only for n odd and positive.
        Parameters:
        m - any integer
        n - an odd positive integer
        Returns:
        Jacobi symbol (m/n) of m and n.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if n is even or negative.

      • kroneckerSymbol

        public static int kroneckerSymbol(int m,
                  int n)
        Extension of the Jacobi symbol to all integers m and n.
        Parameters:
        m - any integer
        n - any integer
        Returns:
        Kronecker symbol (m/n) of m and n.
